question: Striated veebrae is seen in WHICH OF THE FOLOWING CONDITION?
exp: In Hemangioma there is loss of horizontal straition and prominence of veebral straiation giving veebra a typical striated appaerance on radiography Refer: MAHESWARI 9. TH ED

question: In which of the following conditions polyostotic lesions are not seen
exp: Multiple tumors are Fibrous dysplasia GCT Osteochondroma Enchondroma Hemangioma Multiple myeloma Refer clinical imaging by Denis Marchiori 1112p
